1.1: Paul the prisoner of Christ Jesus and Timothy the brother Philemon to our beloved and fellow worker
1.2: And Apphia to our sister and Archippus to our fellow soldier and to the church in your house;
1.3: grace to you and peace from God our father and Lord Jesus Christ.
1.4: I thank my god always remembering you in my prayers,
1.5: I hear your love and faith in the Lord Jesus and in all the saints,
1.6: as the communion of your faith becomes active in the knowledge of all the good that is in us in Christ;
1.7: for there is much joy and prayer for your love, because the souls of the saints rest for you, brother.
1.8: For, having much presence in Christ, I have ordered you to do what you need,
1.9: for the sake of love I beseech you, who, like Paul, is a presbyter, but now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus
1.10: I am begging you about my son, whom I gave birth to in the bonds of Onesimus,
1.11: what was once useless to you is now [and] useful to you and me,
1.12: whom he sent to thee, he, that is my entrails;
1.13: whom I desire to possess, that he may minister for me in the bonds of the gospel,
1.14: But without your opinion, I did not want you to do anything, so that your good is not out of necessity, but out of your own free will.
1.15: for it was for this reason that it was set apart for a time, so that you could avoid it eternally,
1.16: not as a servant, but as a servant, a beloved brother, even we, but how much more so, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
1.17: If, then, you have a partner with me, hire him as I do.
1.18: If he did not judge you or owe you, this is what I said;
1.19: I, Paul, have written with my own hand, I deny it, so that I may not tell you that you also reproach me.
1.20: yes, brother, I bless you in the Lord; rest my bowels in Christ.
1.21: Believing in your obedience, I wrote to you, knowing that you also write about what I say.
1.22: But prepare a guest for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be acceptable to you.
1.23: My captive in Christ Jesus is delivered to Epaphras,
1.24: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my accomplices.
1.25: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ with your spirit.
